title: Poland: Citi Volunteers Run Warsaw Marathon to Raise Money for Children in Brezie
summary: Warsaw, Poland - Seventeen Citi employees took part in the 34th Warsaw Marathon in celebration of Citi's 200 year-anniversary as well as to raise money for the Multifunctional Education Institution in Brzezie.
tag-1: Poland: Citi Volunteers Run Warsaw Marathon to Raise Money for Children in Brezie
tag-2: Warsaw, Poland – Seventeen Citi employees took part in the 34th Warsaw Marathon in celebration of Citi's 200 year-anniversary as well as to raise money for the Multifunctional Education Institution in Brzezie.
tag-3: Citi Handlowy's Kronenberg Foundation pledged to pay PLN 10 for every kilometer run by marathoners, and so far more than PLN 7,000 has been raised for the Multifunctional Education Institution. Money raised will go towards organizing a '2013 Sports and Cultural Marathon' for children from the Institution and will be able to visit places associated with the history of Bank Handlowy and the Kronenberg family.
tag-4: Brzezie is a place that is very special to Citi Handlowy volunteers. Earlier this year in June, our volunteers had been busy taking on repairs at the Institution and organizing activities for the kids. "As the corporate social responsibility leader, we want to actively help local communities, especially those communities who are part of our history," said Krzysztof Kaczmar, President of the Kronenberg Foundation of Bank Handlowy.
tag-5: "At Citi we are committed to supporting the communities where we live and work. I am therefore delighted that the Kronenberg Foundation of Citi Handlowy has been able to support the incredible of effort of our employees who have run the Warsaw Marathon. Not only have they achieved personally by completing the run, but importantly they have also helped disadvantaged children who will now have the opportunity to learn more about their cultural heritage. I'd like to say a big thank you to our employees who took part – they have set an example for all of across Citi," commented Rachael Barber, Head of Community Development, EMEA at Citi.
tag-6: The marathon was a success for Citi Handlowy thanks to the commitment and passion of CitiClub-Runners – bringing together employees from Citibank International Plc, Citibank Europe Plc and Citi Handlowy. "We love running and we love helping others. Today we have managed to combine both," said Barbara Muzyka, who coordinated preparations for Citi runners.
tag-7: The event has been a great forerunner to the recently launched Citi Fitness Challenge. Aimed at promoting a healthy and active lifestyle and work-life balance, the initiative also has a social responsibility dimension. Citi will award employees points for achieving their fitness goals which can then be used to donate money to Habitat for Humanity International, United Way Worldwide and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-10: Citi Handlowy Citi Handlowy is one of the major financial institutions in Poland and offers, under the Citi Handlowy brand, a broad range of state-of-the-art products in corporate, investment and consumer banking. Through its modern distribution channels and a network of 96 branches, Bank Handlowy services 20,000 corporate customers and 965,000 individual ones. The Bank's group includes Dom Maklerski Banku Handlowego (brokerage house) and Handlowy Leasing. Being a member of Citi enables the customers of Bank Handlowy access to financial services provided in over 100 countries. Further information is available at www.citihandlowy.pl.
tag-11: Kronenberg Foundation  Since its establishment in 1996 the Kronenberg Foundation has supported its founder, Citi Handlowy, in pursuing its community mission in such areas as education, support to local communities and preservation of cultural heritage. Its projects include, among others, My Finances – a financial education program for secondary school students, organized in cooperation with the National Bank of Poland and the Junior Achievement Foundation; Employee Volunteering Program (developed to encourage community involvement among the employees of Citi Handlowy), competitions: Microentrepreneur of the Year and Competition for Bank Handlowy Award for Special Achievements in the Theory of Economics and Finance, as well as the Aleksander Gieysztor Award for outstanding achievements in the preservation of Polish cultural heritage.
